title: Yifei Yang
text:
我的 个人主页 是基于 Chi Zhang (github) 的个人主页修改而来的。
你可以 Fork 本仓库，然后酌情修改你的个人信息，编译后即可生成你的个人主页。这种方法无需注册域名，也不用学习 HTML 和 CSS 等前端知识，直接使用 GitHub Pages 即可完成个人主页的搭建。
具体制作过程参见：

连小白, 2025, 50 分钟搞定个人主页：Fork 模板 + GitHub Pages + Quarto 完整教程.

本仓库的使用方法：

你可以点击本页右上方的 ⭐Star 按钮来收藏本仓库，方便日后查阅；
也可以点击 Use this template 按钮来快速 Fork 本仓库。
你制作个人主页期间有任何问题，可以在 Discussions 提问和讨论。



主页 | 课程 | 视频 | 推文 | 资料

title: Yifei Yang
text:
我的 个人主页 是基于 Chi Zhang (github) 的个人主页修改而来的。
你可以 Fork 本仓库，然后酌情修改你的个人信息，编译后即可生成你的个人主页。这种方法无需注册域名，也不用学习 HTML 和 CSS 等前端知识，直接使用 GitHub Pages 即可完成个人主页的搭建。
具体制作过程参见：

连小白, 2025, 50 分钟搞定个人主页：Fork 模板 + GitHub Pages + Quarto 完整教程.

本仓库的使用方法：

你可以点击本页右上方的 ⭐Star 按钮来收藏本仓库，方便日后查阅；
也可以点击 Use this template 按钮来快速 Fork 本仓库。
你制作个人主页期间有任何问题，可以在 Discussions 提问和讨论。

title: Yifei Yang
text:
Email
  
  
    
     YEERF
  
  
    
     CV
  

  
  
I am a third-year undergraduate jointly enrolled at Beijing Jiaotong University and Lancaster University (B.Eng. in Communication Engineering, expected Jun 2027).
I am currently a Research Intern at the Institute for AI Industry Research (AIR), Tsinghua University, supervised by Prof. Yan Wang. Previouly, I was a Algorithm Intern in Wuxi Research Institute of Applied Technologies, Tsinghua University (AIRIC).
My research interests focus on GenAI and Embodied AI, especially VLA, VLN and World Models for Robotics.



2025.01 - present: Research Intern, Institute for AI Industry Research (AIR), Tsinghua University
2025.07 - 2025.08: Algorithm Intern, Wuxi Research Institute of Applied Technologies, Tsinghua University (AIRIC)
2023.09 - present: Undergrated Student, Beijing Jiaotong University and Lancaster University.

title: Yifei Yang
text:
2025.01 - present: Research Intern, Institute for AI Industry Research (AIR), Tsinghua University
2025.07 - 2025.08: Algorithm Intern, Wuxi Research Institute of Applied Technologies, Tsinghua University (AIRIC)
2023.09 - present: Undergrated Student, Beijing Jiaotong University and Lancaster University.

title: Yifei Yang
text:
Email: yifei05.yang@gmail.com
Tel: (+86) 13326268486



Beijing Jiaotong University, China
Sep 2023 - present
Bachelor of Engineering in Communication Engineering (expected in Jun 2027)
Lancaster University, UK
Sep 2023 - present






May 2024 - May 2025
Advisor: Prof. Hang Zhou (Associate Professor, School of Electronic and Information Engineering, Beijing Jiaotong University)



Proposed a low-high frequency fusion framework for anti-UAV detection and tracking in low-light and dynamic-background scenarios.

Designed the Decoupling Light and Reconstructing (DLR) module to disentangle illumination cues and extract light-source-aware low-frequency features, improving robustness to lighting variation.

Developed the Null Space Super-Resolution Model (NSRM) module to recover high-frequency motion details via null-space decomposition and super-resolution, boosting accuracy for fast-moving UAVs.





Jan 2025 - present
Advisor: Prof. Yan Wang (Assistant Professor, Institute for AI Industry Research, Tsinghua University)


Sep 2025 - present
- Proposed changing the reasoning paradigm to address the drift problem in autoregressive long-term sequence generation, while maintaining the accuracy of the conditional embedding.
- Explored better compression methods than the sliding window approach to address the problem of context forgetting.



Apr 2025 - Jul 2025
- Surveyed robotics and embodied learning, focusing on VLA policy learning and diffusion and flow matching-based action generation.
- Reproduced the π0 codebase and validated the execution pipeline end-to-end.



Jan 2025 - Mar 2025
- Surveyed diffusion and Flow Matching theory and used it to guide model design for fast image generation.
- Reproduced a Shortcut single-step diffusion model on canonical inverse problems.







Jul 2025 - Aug 2025



Integrated a robotic arm and multi-sensor stack (camera, force and torque) in ROS2, and debugged end-to-end communication for stable runtime operation.

Implemented model-to-control interfaces for VLA models (π0-series and world-model inference), enabling direct execution of predicted actions on the robot.

Validated grasping, placement, and container-operation demos with sim-to-real consistency by unifying observation and action formats and task scripts.







Award of S, Mathematical Contest in Modeling (MCM) May 2024

Beijing Municipal Undergraduate Innovation Project May 2025





Programming: Python; PyTorch; Multi-GPU distributed training and debugging.

Foundations: Computer Vision and VLA; Familiar with diffusion models and recent VLA methods.

Research: Capable of end-to-end research execution (modeling, experiments, paper writing).

Hardware: Schematic and multi-layer PCB design.
